meanings.definition: Acting as a substitute or replacement.
meanings.sent1: The succedaneous teacher filled in for the regular one who was sick.
meanings.sent2: The succedaneous book was borrowed from the library when the original one was lost.
meanings.sent3: The succedaneous umbrella saved the day when the unexpected rain poured down.
meanings.sent4: Her succedaneous smile brightened the room in the absence of the usual cheerfulness.
meanings.sent5: The succedaneous solution proved to be just as effective as the original remedy.

meanings.sent1: The succedaneous chapters of the story kept the readers engaged till the end.
meanings.sent2: The succedaneous events unfolded smoothly after the initial chaos.
meanings.sent3: The succedaneous songs in the playlist played one after the other seamlessly.
meanings.sent4: His succedaneous remarks echoed the sentiments expressed by the previous speaker.
meanings.sent5: The succedaneous steps in the dance routine flowed gracefully from start to finish.

meanings.sent1: The succedaneous train arrived right on time after the delayed one.
meanings.sent2: The succedaneous generations continued the family tradition of hard work.
meanings.sent3: The succedaneous dessert was even more delicious than the main course.
meanings.sent4: Her succedaneous achievements surpassed all expectations set by her predecessors.
meanings.sent5: The succedaneous sunrise painted the sky with vibrant colors heralding a new day.
